intro: Phlebochiton, commonly known as the African ebony, is a tropical tree native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dark, dense wood that is highly valued for its durability and aesthetic appeal. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. It produces small, white or yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by small, round fruits. The tree is often found in moist, well-drained soils in lowland and montane forests.
